paper_title: Microstructure and mechanical behavior of an additive manufactured (AM) WE43-Mg alloy

graphs.title: Dynamic true stress–true strain at 1000 s⁻¹ (as-built)
graphs.description: SHPB compression of as-built WE43 cylinders under four SLM settings; curves grouped by porosity level.
graphs.about_graph: All tests at ~1000 s⁻¹. Higher porosity lowers flow stress and reduces work-hardening; dashed vertical lines at ~0.02 and ~0.11 true strain mark reference points in the panel.

curves.curve_description: Nearly fully dense build; highest strength among as-built conditions.
curves.about_curve: Initial stress rises rapidly then hardens to ~420 MPa by ε≈0.10.
curves.what_is_different_between_this_curve_and: Lowest porosity → highest flow stress and sustained hardening.
curves.what_is_common_between_this_curve_and_ot: Same alloy, geometry, ~1000 s⁻¹ SHPB test, true metrics and units.

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.020–0.077.

curves.curve_description: Moderately dense build; intermediate flow stress.
curves.about_curve: Lower stresses than #1 but above #7 and #9 throughout strain.
curves.what_is_different_between_this_curve_and: Moderate porosity shifts curve downward relative to #1.

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.022–0.074.

curves.curve_description: Higher-porosity build; reduced initial flow and hardening.
curves.about_curve: Work hardening weaker than #1/#4 due to porosity.
curves.what_is_different_between_this_curve_and: Greater porosity yields lower stress for a given strain.
curves.what_is_common_between_this_curve_and_ot: Same alloy and SHPB setup; true stress–strain.

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.024–0.079.

curves.curve_description: Most porous build; lowest stress and early softening.
curves.about_curve: Lowest curve among as-built; ductility reduced.
curves.what_is_common_between_this_curve_and_ot: Same strain rate, axes and material state (as-built).

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.020–0.074.

graphs.title: Dynamic true stress–true strain at 1000 s⁻¹ (HIP treated)
graphs.description: SHPB compression of HIP’ed WE43 cylinders; porosity reduced vs as-built and curves terminate at shear failure (~0.15 strain).
graphs.about_graph: HIP densifies pores; strength trends converge for #1/#4/#7; #9 remains weakest due to residual porosity.

curves.curve_description: Nearly dense after HIP; strength slightly lower than as-built.
curves.about_curve: Microstructural changes offset densification; failure near ε≈0.15 by shear.
curves.what_is_different_between_this_curve_and: Shows a small strength drop vs its as-built counterpart.

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.023–0.079.

curves.curve_description: Densification offsets microstructural softening; stress comparable to as-built.
curves.about_curve: Intermediate strength; shear failure near ε≈0.15.
curves.what_is_different_between_this_curve_and: Porosity reduced to ~0.6% improves strength over higher-porosity states.

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.022–0.075.

curves.curve_description: Substantial densification relative to as-built; among the higher HIP curves.
curves.about_curve: Higher stresses than #1 HIP at the same strain; failure near ε≈0.15.

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.020–0.077.

curves.curve_description: Residual porosity remains relatively high; lowest HIP curve.
curves.about_curve: Failure occurs at lower stress/strain; densification insufficient to recover strength.
curves.what_is_different_between_this_curve_and: Lowest flow stress due to residual porosity.
curves.what_is_common_between_this_curve_and_ot: Same specimen size, test rate, and axes.

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.023–0.076.

graphs.title: Dynamic true stress–true strain at 1000 s⁻¹: Sample #1 As-built vs HIP
graphs.description: Overlay of Sample #1 in as-built vs HIP conditions to isolate HIP effects at fixed SLM parameters.
graphs.about_graph: As-built shows porosity-dependent strength; HIP modifies both porosity and precipitate populations, shifting curves and often causing shear failure near 0.15 strain.

curves.about_curve: Reflects as-built porosity and precipitate morphology.
curves.what_is_different_between_this_curve_and: Generally higher ductility window than HIP except for highly porous #9.
curves.what_is_common_between_this_curve_and_ot: Same alloy, cylinder geometry, 1000 s⁻¹ SHPB, true stress–strain axes.

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.022–0.078.

curves.curve_description: Dynamic response after HIP densification and precipitate evolution.
curves.about_curve: All HIP curves show abrupt shear failure near ε≈0.15; strength change relative to as-built depends on the balance of densification vs precipitate coarsening.
curves.what_is_different_between_this_curve_and: Often higher initial stress if densification dominates (#7), or lower if microstructural softening dominates (#1).
curves.what_is_common_between_this_curve_and_ot: Same axes and testing protocol; true stress–strain metrics.

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.024–0.076.
